alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Campbell; Hughes; Hyde; Jones; Lyman; Potter; Stanley; Sully; Walworth (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 19 at 12:54PM MST until December 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of one to three inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening to 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Wednesday evening through Saturday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
